title: React Counter Component
description: Create a simple React counter component with increment and decrement buttons. The component will be a functional component using hooks, styled with CSS modules. It will include a reset button and conditionally style the counter display based on its value (red when negative, green when positive). Basic documentation will also be added.

steps.title: Set up project
steps.description: Create a new React project using Create React App. Remove unnecessary boilerplate files and code.

steps.title: Create Counter component
steps.description: Create a new functional component called Counter. Use the useState hook to manage the counter state.

steps.title: Add increment and decrement buttons
steps.description: Add two buttons to the Counter component, one for incrementing and one for decrementing the counter value. Update the counter state when the buttons are clicked.

steps.title: Style with CSS modules
steps.description: Create a CSS module for the Counter component. Style the buttons and counter display.

steps.title: Add reset button
steps.description: Add a reset button to the Counter component that sets the counter value back to 0 when clicked.

steps.title: Conditionally style counter display
steps.description: Update the counter display styling based on the counter value. Display the value in red when negative and green when positive.

steps.title: Add documentation
steps.description: Write basic documentation for the Counter component, including a description of its functionality and how to use it.

steps.title: Test Counter component
steps.description: Write unit tests for the Counter component to ensure it functions as expected.
